basics.name: Woo Seok Jung
basics.label: PhD Candidate
basics.summary: A Korean American PhD candidate in the Brent Lab at WashU

publications.name: FISHNET: A Network-based Tool for Analyzing Gene-level P-values to Identify Significant Genes Missed by Standard Methods
publications.summary: FISHNET uses prior biological knowledge, represented as gene interaction networks and gene function annotations, to identify genes that do not meet the genome-wide significance threshold but replicate nonetheless

publications.name: Construction of Multi-Modal Transcriptome-Small Molecule Interaction Networks from High-Throughput Measurements to Study Human Complex Traits
publications.summary: This study introduces a multi-omics framework that integrates metabolomic, lipidomic, and transcriptomic data using machine learning and semi-supervised network inference to model small moleculeâ€“gene interactions. The approach outperforms existing methods in identifying biologically meaningful networks and reveals novel insights into insulin sensitivity, including links between gut microbiota metabolites and immune pathways. The resulting networks, validated in a large, long-lived human cohort, are made publicly available to support further research.

publications.name: A methodology for gene level omics-WAS integration identifies genes influencing traits associated with cardiovascular risks: the Long Life Family Study
publications.summary: Multi-omic integration of GWAS, RVA (rare variant analysis), and gene-trait associations to identify genetic mechanisms that affect cardiovascular health risks in the Long Life Family Study (LLFS). I wrote the nf-core Nextflow pipeline https://nf-co.re/omicsgenetraitassociation.

publications.name: Predicting which genes will respond to transcription factor perturbations
publications.summary: Prediction of gene response to transcription factor perturbations modeling TF perturbation experiments using TF ChIP-seq data and epigenetic signals using XGBoost.

projects.name: FISHNET
projects.summary: This software pipelines the Nextflow, R, and python code for FISHNET, available for HPC systems using Docker or Singularity containers.

projects.name: nf-core/omicsgenetraitassociation
projects.summary: An open-source Nextflow pipeline for the multi-omic integration of GWAS, TWAS, and RVA available on nf-core.

projects.name: corrmeta
projects.summary: This R package implements correlated meta-analysis, a method which accounts for correlated samples in meta-analyses. Available on CRAN.

awards.title: Genome Analysis Traning Progarm (GATP)
awards.summary: The NHGRI T32 grant, also known as a Ruth L. Kirschstein National Research Service Award (NRSA) Institutional Research Training Grant, supports predoctoral trainees to strenghten their research experiences in genomics.

awards.title: Thomas Malcolm and Hilda Enden Jack Scholarship
